subNodes.conversationText: root

The talking squirrel lies dead. The worms that were eating it have ceased their writhing, giving it peace at last.

You notice that the squirrels had been digging in the corner of the clearing. They have dug a large hole, filled with blood red nuts that you don't recognise.
Investigate the nuts.
You pick one of the nuts up from the hole. It is heavier than you expected. The nut is blood red, with an almost fleshy feel. When you squeeze it, it looks as if it would burst.
Squeeze the nut.
You squeeze the nut until it bursts and a thick, red liquid seeps out all over your hands. You wipe them on your trousers in disgust.
Continue.
"That is the most disgusting thing I've seen all day." Rani pauses for a moment and reflects. "The second most disgusting thing," she corrects herself.
Continue.
The hole is filled with dozens of these red nuts. The squirrels must be harvesting them in the forest and eating them.
Leave.
Eat a nut.
"Wait!" Rani flutters to your ear. "What are you doing? These are no nuts."
Eat the nut anyway.
You bite into the nut and suck down the red fluid. It tastes sweet and delicate.
Continue.
Rani flutters into the air, clearly agitated. "You are crazy," she says. "Absolutely crazy."
Continue.
You feel a sudden stomach cramp and bend over in pain. The pain is gone very quickly, and you immediately feel refreshed and surprisingly stronger.
"Hey, that wasn't so bad, actually."
"No more, though, <FullName>. I need your help, and I don't want you turning into one of those things."
"Yeah, you might be right." [Leave].
"Yeah, you're probably right." [Throw the nut away and leave].

You squeeze the nut until it bursts and a thick, red liquid seeps out all over your hands. You wipe them on your trousers in disgust.

The hole is filled with dozens of these red nuts. The squirrels must be harvesting them in the forest and eating them.
Leave.
Eat the nut.

"Wait!" Anu grabs your wrist. "Look!"

She squeezes one of the nuts in her hand until it bursts, and a blood red liquid seeps out. "These are no nuts."

The hole is filled with dozens of these nuts. The squirrels must be harvesting them in the forest and eating them.
Eat the nut anyway.
You bite into the nut and suck down the red fluid. It tastes sweet and delicate.
Continue.
Anu's eyes are wide behind her mask, and she fingers the hilt of her curved blade. "You are crazy," she says. "Absolutely crazy."
Continue.
You feel a sudden stomach cramp and bend over in pain. The pain is gone very quickly, and you immediately feel refreshed and surprisingly stronger.
"Hey, that wasn't so bad, actually."
"No more, though, <FullName>. I need your help, and I don't want you turning into one of those things."
"Yeah, you're probably right, Anu." [Leave].
Throw the nut away and leave.
"What are you doing!" Ezzbel flaps into your face in a sudden panic. "Don't eat the damn things, you crazy <Race>!"
"Why not?"

"Look!" Ezzbel takes one of the nuts in its claws and squeezes. It bursts, spraying a thick, red liquid gloop. You grimace at the sight.

The hole is filled with dozens of these nuts. The squirrels must be harvesting them in the forest and eating them.
Eat the nut anyway.
You bite into the nut. It bursts in your mouth, and you suck down the red fluid. It tastes sweet and delicate.
Continue.
"What?! You didn't just... you didn't just... you did! What are you thinking? You're crazy, <Race>, crazy!"
Continue.
You feel a sudden stomach cramp and bend over in pain. The pain is gone very quickly, and you immediately feel refreshed and surprisingly stronger.
"Hey, that wasn't so bad, actually."
Ezzbel flaps nervously. "We're leaving, now, <Race>. I don't want you turning into one of them."
Continue.
Throw the nut away and leave.
You bite into the nut. It bursts in your mouth, and you suck down the red fluid. It tastes sweet and delicate.
Continue.
You feel a sudden stomach cramp and bend over in pain. The pain is gone very quickly, and you immediately feel refreshed ands surprisingly stronger.
Continue
You feel uneasy about eating any more nuts, and decide to leave the rest of them where they lie.
Leave.
